summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER. WHILE DRIVING VARIOUS SPEEDS, EXCESSIVE FORCE HAD TO BE APPLIED TO THE BRAKE PEDAL TO STOP THE VEHICLE. THE FAILURE OCCURRED WITHOUT WARNING. LODI CHRYSLER JEEP DODGE RAM (1255 BECKMAN RD, LODI, CA) DIAGNOSED THAT THE ABS PUMP MODULE ASSEMBLY AND BRAKE ACTUATOR ASSEMBLY FAILED. THE PARTS WERE INCLUDED IN A LIFETIME CHRYSLER CUSTOMER SATISFACTION CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 682; HOWEVER, THE PARTS WERE UNAVAILABLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND REFUSED TO HONOR THE CAMPAIGN BECAUSE THEY NO LONGER MANUFACTURED THE PARTS FOR THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 189,000.

THIS VAN IS AFFECTED BY THE 96V099000 NHTSA RECALL, HOWEVER WHEN INQUIRING ABOUT GETTING THE ABS MOTOR REPLACED AT A LOCAL DEALERSHIP I WAS TOLD THAT THE PARTS ARE NO LONGER MADE TO FIX THIS ISSUE.  I BELIEVE THAT CHRYSLER HAS A DUTY TO FIX THE BRAKES ON THIS VEHICLE AS DIRECTED BY THE NHTSA, PARTS OBSOLESCENCE DOES NOT ABSOLVE THEM FROM RESPONSIBILITY OR THE NHTSA.  IF THE PARTS ARE NO LONGER AVAILABLE I REQUEST THAT CHRYSLER PURCHASE THE VAN BACK FROM ME AND HAVE IT DESTROYED, FIX THE BRAKES ACCORDING TO THE RECALL OR CONVERT THE BRAKES TO THE NON-ABS TYPE.  I DO NOT UNDERSTAND HOW CHRYSLER AND THE NHTSA COULD ALLOW BENDIX (THE MANUFACTURER OF THIS RATHER PROBLEMATIC BRAKE SYSTEM) TO STOP MAKING A LIFETIME REPLACEMENT PART.      THIS ISSUE CAUSES THE POWER ASSIST TO STOP WORKING, CREATES A HARD PEDAL WHICH MAKES IT IMPOSSIBLE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE SAFELY.  THIS CREATES A CONDITION WORSE THAN A VEHICLE WITH ALL MANUAL BRAKES THAT HAVE NO POWER / VACUUM ASSIST TO BEGIN WITH, WHEN TEST DRIVING THE VEHICLE IT TAKES BOTH FEET PLANTED FIRMLY ON THE PEDAL TO STOP IT.    AS I HAVE NOT GOTTEN A SATISFACTORY SOLUTION THAT WAS MANDATED AND ENFORCED BY THE NHTSA, I LOOK FORWARD TO YOUR PROMPT REPLY IN THIS MATTER.  *TR
WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 40 MPH, THE SPARE TIRE FELL FROM UNDER THE VAN.   *TR

EXPERIENCED HARD BRAKE PEDAL (LOSE OF BRAKING) AND BRAKE / ABS LIGHTS ILLUMINATED ON THE DASH BOARD.  THIS WAS THE SECOND FAILURE IN THE LAST TWO YEARS AFTER APPROXIMATELY 14,000 MILES OF OPERATION SINCE THE LAST REPAIR AND FOR AT LEAST THE FOURTH TIME SINCE WE HAVE OWNED THIS VEHICLE (BOUGHT NEW).    PREVIOUS REPAIR INVOLVED REPLACEMENT OF BRAKE ACCUMULATOR, DUAL PRESSURE SWITCH, BRAKE ACTUATOR PISTON ASSEMBLY, AND THE PUMP MOTOR ASSEMBLY, THE LAST TWO OF WHICH ARE SUBJECT TO A LIFETIME RECALL.  DEALER REFUSES TO REPAIR/REPLACE WARRANTED PARTS WITHOUT AGREEMENT THAT OTHER PARTS ARE REPLACED AT A COST OF APPROXIMATELY $900.  GIVEN THAT IT IS LIKELY THAT WARRANTED PART FAILURES ARE LEADING TO THE FAILURE OF THE OTHER COMPONENTS AND THAT THE LAST REPAIR ONLY LASTED FOR 14,000 MILE WE REQUESTED THAT CHRYSLER COVER THE ENTIRE REPAIR.  CHRYSLER REFUSED.  IN ADDITION, IT HAS BEEN OUR EXPERIENCE THAT EACH TIME WE HAVE HAD THE BRAKE SYSTEM FAIL, IT HAS INCLUDED THE NEED TO REPLACE OTHER BRAKE SYSTEM COMPONENTS BEYOND THE PARTS SUBJECT TO THE LIFETIME RECALL.  THUS IT WOULD APPEAR THAT THE LIFETIME RECALL SHOULD HAVE BEEN EXPANDED TO COVER ALL OF THE COMPONENTS IMPACTED BY THE FAILURE OF THE WARRANTED COMPONENTS.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 15 MPH, THERE WAS A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM THE VEHICLE. AFTER PULLING OVER SHE NOTICED THAT THE FUEL RAIL WAS FRACTURED AND PARTIALLY HANGING FROM THE VEHICLE. IN ADDITION, THE SLIDING PASSENGER SIDE DOOR WOULD SPORADICALLY COME OFF TRACK AND COULD NOT BE CLOSED PROPERLY. THE DOOR WAS CLOSED USING A CORD.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHERE THEY ADVISED HER THAT THEY WOULD HAVE TO TAKE THE DOOR APART FOR REALIGNMENT. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND THEY OFFERED NO ASSISTANCE, STATING THAT THERE WERE NO RECALLS ON THE VEHICLE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 160,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER. WHILE DRIVING AT 35 MPH, THE CONTACT ATTEMPTED TO USE THE BRAKES BUT THE VEHICLE DID NOT SLOW DOWN. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALERSHIP BUT NO REPAIRS WERE PERFORMED AT THE TIME OF THE COMPLAINT BECAUSE THE PARTS WERE NO LONGER AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT REFERENCED RECALL 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC: ANTILOCK) AS SHE FELT IT WAS RELATED TO THE FAILURE. THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 196,555.

TWO WEEKS AGO THE ABS AND BRAKE LIGHTS CAME ON IN MY 1992 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER MINI-VAN. AT THAT MOMENT THERE WAS NO HYDRAULIC BRAKE PRESSURE AND IT WAS VERY DIFFICULT TO CONTROL THE VAN. THE VAN WAS TOWED TO MY REGULAR, INDEPENDENT REPAIR SHOP AND THEY CHECKED THE CONDITION AND THEIR DIAGNOSTIC COMPUTER ISSUED A CODED ERROR. I DISCOVERED THAT THIS ABS BRAKE WAS COVERED UNDER AN EXTENDED WARRANTY BY CHRYSLER. I TOOK THE VAN TO A NEARBY CHRYSLER DEALER AND THEY CHECKED. THE ABS LIGHT AND BRAKE LIGHT WERE OUT AT THIS TIME AND THE DEALER CHARGED FOR ONE HOUR, GAVE ME LIST OF PARTS THEY CONSIDERED MAY NEED TO BE REPLACED AND VERBALLY SAID IT MAY COST ABOUT $400 OR MORE TO FIX. THEY DID NOT ASSURE ME THAT A WARRANTY WOULD APPLY.  *TR

MY ABS LIGHT CAME ON AND A FEW DAYS LATER MY MASTER CYLINDER FAILED RESULTING IN NO BREAKS. I WAS ABLE TO GET TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD FOR A TOW. I HAVE PAID TO GET REPAIRS COMPLETED. CHRYSLER TELLS ME MY CAR IS NOT COVERED BY RECALL. I DISPUTE THIS. RECALL # 96V099000.  *TR
TRANSMISSION IS LEAKING FROM FRONT PUMP SEAL AND FROM WHAT I HAVE BEEN TOLD ALL OF THE CARAVAN,VOYAGER AND TOWN & COUNTRY'S DO THIS BECAUSE THEY WERE NOT DESIGNED CORRECTLY. *JB
1992 DODGE  PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER LE  THE STEERING WHEEL BROKE UP UNDER THE VAN WHILE I WAS DRIVING,CAUSING ME TO CRASH INTO SOME ONE ELSE VEHICLE.*JB
I HAVE A PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER IN WHICH WAS INVOLVED IN AN EARLIER RE CALL FOR THE ABS BRAKES NOW THEY FAILED AGAIN*AK

THE BRAKES HAVE BEEN DEFECTIVE SINCE THE CONSUMER OWNED THE VEHICLE.  THE BRAKES HAVE BEEN SERVICED EVERY YEAR. CONSUMER HAS TO PRESS ON THE BRAKES WITH BOTH FEET TO STOP THE VEHICLE.  THE BRAKES REMAIN DEFECTIVE.*AK

TREAD SEPARATION IN TIRE.  THE TIRE WAS A P205/17R15 WITH DOT U9M0 LBX2701 F01L.  THE TIRE NAME WAS RESPONSE RST TOURING 2000.  THE TIRE HAD 16000 MILES AND WAS ON THE VEHICLE 16 MAR 2002 TO 19 SEP 2004.  THE TIRE WAS SOLD AND INSTALLED BY NTB, NATIONAL TIRE & BATTERY, STAFFORD, TX.      OWNER DEDUCED THE SEPARATION AFTER THE DEFECTIVE TIRE WAS ROTATED TO THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE AND LATER NOTICED THE BUMP FROM THE TREAD SEPARATION.  NTB STATED THAT THE REMAINING 3 TIRES WOULD ALSO FAIL BY TREAD SEPARATION.  ALL FOUR TIRES WERE REPLACED.  NONE OF THE TIRES WAS REPLACED FREE OF CHARGE.

THE BRAKE PEDAL HAD BECAME HARD AND WOULDN'T GO DOWN WHEN DEPRESSED.  THE CONSUMER COASTED THE VEHICLE  INTO THE DRIVEWAY AND ENGAGED THE PARKING BRAKE TO STOP.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE  DEALER, AND THE MECHANIC PERFORMED A DIAGNOSTIC TEST THAT INDICATED THAT THE HYDRAULIC BRAKE PUMP MOTOR ASSEMBLY  MALFUNCTIONED.  ALSO, THERE WAS RECALL 96V099000 CONCERNING ANTI SKID BRAKE SYSTEM.  HOWEVER, THE DEALERSHIP INDICATED THAT THIS RECALL HAD ALREADY BEEN PERFORMED.  THE REMEDY FAILED, AND THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT HONORING THE WARRANTY AS STATED IN THE RECALL, AND WERE NOT SENDING THE RECALL PART TO THE DEALERSHIP BECAUSE THE  DEALERSHIP WAS UNABLE TO GET A DIAGNOSTIC TEST CODE INDICATING THAT THE RECALL PART FAILED, ALTHOUGH  THE DEALERSHIP DUPLICATED THE PROBLEM , AND INDICATED THAT  THE RECALL PART WAS CAUSING THE PROBLEM.   *AK   (THE SECOND CONSUMER:  TARA BETH)   *SC *JB

I HAD THIS VEHICLE FOR A VERY SHORT TIME WHEN I STARTED TO HAVE PROBLEMS WITH THE SLIDING DOOR NOT STAYING CLOSED. AFTER IT IS SHUT IT POPS OPEN IMMEDIATELY. I HAVE HAD THE BOLT ADJUSTED SEVERAL TIMES AND IT WOULD KEEP IT CLOSED, BUT NOT FOR LONG. AFTER IT HAD BEEN OPENED AND SHUT 2-5 TIMES IT WOULD AGAIN POP OPEN. THIS IS AN ON GOING PROBLEM. I HAVE PARKED THE VEHICLE AND WILL NOT DRIVE IT AND FEAR TO SELL IT DUE TO THIS MALFUNCTION OF THE SLIDING DOOR. SOMEONE SHOULD REPLACE THIS FOR FREE, BUT WHO? I AM A SINGLE MOTHER WITH 4 CHILDREN AND USED TO RELY ON A MINI-VAN.*AK

WHILE APPLYING THE BRAKE THE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR WHICH CAUSED A LOSS OF BRAKING POWER.  THE DRIVER WAS ABLE TO CONTROL THE VEHICLE AND DROVE IT TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION.  THE MECHANIC INFORMED THE DRIVER THAT THE  DUAL FUNCTION PRESSURE SYSTEM, PERTAINING TO  HYDRAULIC ASSEMBLY NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.   *LA   *NM

WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS IDLING CONSUMER SMELLED A STRONG  GASOLINE ODOR. CONSUMER OPENED THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT, AND OBSERVED GAS DRIPPING FROM THE FUEL RAIL.  VEHICLE WAS IMMEDIATELY PARKED, AND THE MANUFACTURER WAS INFORMED.*AK   *NM

ABS FAILED WHILE I WAS DRIVING. WHEN I PUSHED ON THE BRAKES IT FELT LIKE I WAS HITITNG A ROCK . TOOK FOREVER TO STOP. VAN IS CURRENTLY AT MECHANICS. THEY SAID EGULAR BRAKES FINE WILL NOTIFY ME MONDAY WHAT PROBLEM IS WITH ABS.*AK
THE FRONT SEAT RECLINER BRACKET HAS CRACKED CAUSING A SAFETY HAZARD. THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT WILL NOT STAY UPRIGHT .  *JB

components: STEERING,SUSPENSION,SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE,VISIBILITY,AIR BAGS,STRUCTURE,TIRES,WHEELS,UNKNOWN OR OTHER
summary: I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW MORE ABOUT THE RECALLS FOR THE ABOVE VEHICLE AND WHAT EXACTLY THEY COVER AND DON'T COVER AND I GO ABOUT GETTING THEM FIXED.  MY CAR IS NOW IN THE SHOP FOR FAILURE OF BRAKES.  WHILE I WAS OUT DRIVING THE BRAKES SUDDENLY WENT ON ME

THEY REPAINTED THE HOOD FOR ME IF I WAS WILLING TO PAY HALF AND NOW IT IS DOING THE SAME THING ALL OVER AGAIN BUT WORST.  THE WOOD PANELING ON THE SIDES IS JUST PEELING AWAY AND THE CAR LOOKS LIKE CRAP ON THE OUTSIDE BUT IS STILL RUNNING GOOD DUE TO ALL THE MONEY WE PUT INTO IT.  THE BRAKES HAVE BEEN FIXED TWICE FOR A FAULTY SWITCH AND RELAY SWITCH DUE TO THE ABS BRAKE SYSTEM.  I WAS OUT DRIVING JUST THIS PAST WEEK AND WITHOUT WARNING I LOST MY BRAKES AND I AM SUFFERING FROM MS SO I HAD A GREAT DEAL OF DIFFULTY STOPPING THE VEHCILE WITH ONE FOOT I HAD TO USE TWO FEET AND PRAYED A LOT JUST TO GET BACK HOME.
ABS PUMP FAILED WHILE DRIVING. PUMP RAN ON AND OFF. DEALER  WAS SORRY,  NOTHING  COULD BE DONE ABOUT IT. *AK
AIR BAG FAILURE.  *JB

MY 1992 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER MINIVAN HAS EXPERIENCED RECURRING FAILURE OF THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKING SYSTEM. THE BRAKE SYSTEM WARNING LIGHT AND ABS WARNING LIGHT BOTH ILLUMINATED. ON OCCASION THE SYSTEM RESUMED OPERATION IF THE VEHICLE WAS TURNED OFF OR NOT DRIVEN FOR 2 OR MORE HOURS.    IN MARCH OF 2003 A LOCAL GARAGE DIAGNOSED THE ABS RELAY WAS NOT PROVIDING POWER TO THE ABS PUMP. THE RELAY WAS REPLACED - COST $100. DAYS LATER THE SYSTEM FAILED AGAIN. THE PUMP WOULD ONLY OPERATE IF CONNECTED TO DIRECT BATTERY VOLTAGE TO START IT RUNNING.     IN LATE APRIL THE ABS PUMP WAS REPLACED BY ANOTHER LOCAL GARAGE  COST OVER $500. THE SYSTEM OPERATED ANOTHER 3 WEEKS, AND THEN FAILED AGAIN, COMPLETELY FAILING DURING IN MID-JUNE. THE VAN WAS TOWED TO THE SAME GARAGE. THE TECHNICIAN IDENTIFIED THAT THE ABS RELAY COIL HAD FAILED. THE VAN IS UN-DRIVABLE BECAUSE THE ABS PUMP ALSO SUPPLIES POWER BRAKE PRESSURE.    THE VAN WAS TOWED TO CHRIS LEITH DODGE IN WAKE FOREST, NC ON JULY 3, 2003 AND INSPECTED. ON JULY 11, 2003 THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT LET ME KNOW THAT THEY NEEDED THE DISTRICT MANAGER TO MAKE DETERMINATION OF RECALL WARRANTY REPAIR OF THE SYSTEM. JULY 15, 2003, THE SERVICE MANAGER AND DISTRICT MANAGER DETERMINED THAT THE PART THE TECHNICIAN IDENTIFIED AS MALFUNCTIONING (HYDRAULIC ASSEMBLY R-4683398) WAS NOT A PART OF RECALL 96V-099 # 685. THE ABS PUMP IS PART OF THE RECALL AND WAS TO BE WARRANTED FOR LIFE. THE RECALL ALSO STATES THAT REPAIRS DONE EARLIER TO THIS PART WERE TO BE REIMBURSED AS A PART OF THIS RECALL.     I AWAIT INFORMATION ON HOW LONG IT WILL TAKE TO OBTAIN AND INSTALL REPAIR PARTS. THE REPAIR ESTIMATE IS $999.84. THE VAN WAS PURCHASED USED FOR $1800. REPAIRS ARE NEARING THAT VALUE. ACCORDING TO COMPLAINTS AND THE ENGINEERING EVALUATION THIS IS A RECURRING PROBLEM. I KNOW THE VAN IS NOT NEW, BUT AT LEAST IT CAN BE SAFE, OR THE PUBLIC SHOULD BE WARNED NOT TO KEEP THESE VEHICLES IN OPERATION IF CHRYSLER WILL NOT HONOR THE TERMS AND SPIRIT OF THE RECALL.
WHILE DRIVING THE TRANSMISSION SHIFTED ITSELF INTO NEUTRAL UNTIL THE SPEED DECREASED AND THEN AUTOMATICALLY DEFAULTED INTO 2ND GEAR.  *NLM

THAT THE ABS BRAKE LIGHT ILLUMINATED ON THE DASHBOARD, AND ALL BRAKING ABILITY WAS LOST.  A DIAGNOSTIC TEST WAS PERFORMED TWICE AND IT WAS DISCOVERED THE BRAKING SYSTEM WAS DEFECTIVE.  THE ABS CONTROL MODULAR, AND ACCUMULATOR NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.   *JB
FUEL SPILLED OUT OF THE FUEL RAIL. *JB
FRONT SEAT BELT RETRACTOR LOCKED ON PASSENGER SIDE - CHECKED TO SEE IF IT WAS JAMMED - NO IT'S JUST LOCKED IN A CLOSE POSITION.   *NLM

THE BOLT THAT HOLDS THE TENTION PULLEY ARM ON THE ENGINE, BROKE, RELEASING THE BELT FROM ALL OF THE OTHER PULLEYS. THIS CAUSED THE POWER STEERING, WATER PUMP, AND ALTERNATOR TO FAIL. THIS HAPPENED TWICE WITHIN THREE AND A HALF YEARS.

CONSUMER STATES THE DRIVERS SIDE AIR BAG DEPLOYED WHILE GOING 5MPH. ALSO, THE CONSUMER STATES 1 HOUR EARLIER THE SAME DAY THE AIR BAG LIGHT ILLUMINATED AND WENT OFF. THE DEALER IS AWARE OF THE PROBLEM. PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.      TS

REAR WINDSHIELD WIPER CONTSTANTLY GETS STUCK IN UPRIGHT POSITION, OBSTRUCTING DRIVERS' VIEW.  ALSO, CAN HEAR THE MOTOR RUNNING ON THE WIPER SYSTEM, BUT THEY DO NOT ENGAGE.  PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS.  *AK
WHILE PULLING FROM A LIGHT  DRIVER'S SIDE AIRBAG DEPLOYED FOR NO REASON.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK
UNDERHOOD WIRING HARNESS CAUGHT ON FIRE.  *AK
WIPER RECALL WAS PERFORMED IN APRIL 2001, AT THIS TIME WIPERS FAILED AGAIN.   NLM
WHILE DRIVING AND MAKING A LEFT TURN PASSENGER'S DOOR OPENED, WHICH WAS CAUSED BY A MALFUNCTION IN HINCHES THAT WERE NEVER WELDED.*AK

ABS LIGHT ILLUMINATED WHILE TRAVELING. CONSUMER HEARD A PUMPING NOISE WHEN DEPRESSING  BRAKES. BRAKES HAD LOW PRESSURE WHEN DEPRESSED. DEALER HAD REPAIRED ONCE, BUT PROBLEM RETURNED.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION. *AK

VEHICLE WAS IN THE PARK GEAR AND IDLING WHEN IT ROLLED IN REVERSE  WITH A CHILD RESTRAINED IN A CHILD SAFETY  SEAT BEFORE CRASHING THROUGH A FENCE, AND BEING STOPPED BY A PILE OF WOOD.   DEALERSHIP HAS NOT EXAMINED  VEHICLE.  *AK  *SLC
ABS PUMP CONTINUALLY OPERATES AND NORMAL BRAKING PRESSURE IS NOW SOFT. SAME AS RECALLED PROBLEM, BUT THIS VAN'S VIN IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL! *AK

TREAD SEPARATED FROM TIRE AS WE WERE PULLING ONTO  FREEWAY, SPRAYING BLACK ADHESIVE ALL OVER  SIDE OF THE CAR AND DAMAGING  BUMPER, WHEEL WELL SHROUD AND TRIM PIECES.  NOTE: WE STILL HAVE THE FAILED TIRE AND THE OTHER FRONT TIRE IF YOU WANT TO INSPECT THEM.  *AK (DOT NUMBER: W2MO 1NR  TIRESIZE: P205/70R15)
WHEN APPLYING  BRAKES  ABS BRAKE LIGHT ILLUMINATES ON  DASHBOARD, AND  PEDAL BECOMES EXTREMELY HARD AND RESISTFUL, CAUSING TOTAL BRAKE FAILURE. PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.*AK

THE REARWINDSHIELD  WIPERS FAILS AND THE FUSE BLOWS OUT.  ONCE I CHECKED WITH THE DEALER AND UNOFFICIALLY I WAS TOLD THAT THIS IS A MOTOR PORBLEM.  I CONTINUED CHANGING THE FUSES WHENEVER IT BLOWED.  BUT NOW THE WIPPER HAS FAILED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE REAR WINDOW AND THE CHANGE OF THE FUSE DOES NOT WORK.*AK

ABS LIGHT STAYED LIT ON  DASHBOARD.  WHEN BRAKES  WERE APPLIED FOR HARD BRAKING  WHEELS LOCKED UP, AND VEHICLE SLID, MEANING THAT  ABS FAILED TO OPERATE PROPERLY.  A PRIVATE MECHANIC AND DEALERSHIP HAD GIVEN  DIFFERENT REASONS THAT MIGHT CAUSE THIS TO OCCUR.   MANUFACTURER INFORMED  CONSUMER THAT RECALL 96V099000  REPAIRS HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN  DONE.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.  *AK
DRIVER'S SIDE REAR TIRE FAILED, BLOW OUT OCCURRED, VAN ROLLED 4 TIMES.  *AK (TIRESIZE: P205/70RI5)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: P205/70RI5 )

BRAKE BOOSTER SENSOR IS MALFUNCTIONING.  BRAKE ACTS LIKE VEHICLE IS SKIDDING ALL THE TIME AT ANY SPEED.  ABS LIGHT COMES ON AND GOES OFF.  MECHANIC AT THE REPAIR SHOP SAYS BRAKES PEDAL WILL FREEZE IF NOT REPAIRED.   DEALER FOLLOWED UP BY DOING A DIAGNOSTIC TESTING. SENSOR HAS A PROBLEM AND NEEDS REPLACEMENT.  CONSUMER WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COVERAGE.*AK

VEHICLE WAS INVOLVED CRASH FROM  RIGHT SIDE CENTER OF  DOOR POST WHICH CAUSED PASSENGER'S SEAT BELT TO TIGHTEN  HARD ENOUGH TO PUT A BELT PRINT ON  PASSENGER CHEST..  DEALER / MANUFACTURER WERE NOT NOTIFIED AT THIS TIME.  *AK  ONE PERSON WAS INJURED IN ACCIDENT.   *SLC

HEADLIGT LENSES ARE DISCOLORED AND CAUSE POOR VISIBILITY WHEN DRIVING AT NIGHT. DEALER / MANUFACTURER  WERE NOT NOTIFIED AT THIS TIME.  PLEASE FEEL FREE TO PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS ON THIS MATTER. *AK
VEHICLE HAS BEEN REPAIRED  UNDER RECALL   96V099000/ ABS BRAKE SYSTEM FAILURE.   HOWEVER,  DEFECT CONTINUES TO EXIST.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.*AK
TRANSMISSION  HAS FAILED .  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION / ATTACHMENTS.*AK

A GRINDING NOISE WAS HEARD WHEN THE STEERING WHEEL WAS TURNED. UPON INVESTIGATION, I NOTICE THE RACK AND PINION WAS MOVING. WHEN I TRIED TO TIGHTEN THE BOLT IT SNAPPED WITH LITTLE TENSION. LOOKING AT THE BOLT YOU CAN SEE THE BOLT WAS SHEARING. THE BOLT IS APPROXIMATELY 10MM. IT HAD SHEARED TO ABOUT 2MM WHICH SNAPPED WHEN I TRIED TO TIGHTEN.*AK

CONSUMER HAD  RECALL97V079000/ MANUFACTURER'S RECALL 730 FOR LIFTGATE SUPPORT BRACKET REPAIRS DONE IN 1997. LIFTGATE FELL, HITTING CONSUMER ON  HEAD. CONSUMER COMPLAINED, AND MANUFACTURER SAID THEY COULD BE OF NO ASSISTANCE TO HIM. *AK  THE ATTACH BOLT FOR THE LIFT GATE SUPPORT SHEARED OFF WHILE SOME PORTION OF IT REMAINED IN THE BODY OF THE VEHICLE.  *YH

VEHICLE WAS RECALLED FOR  REAR LATCH.   LATCH WAS REPLACED COUPLE YEARS AGO. BUT, ATTACHING HARDWARE CAME A LOOSE AND FELL OUT, AND LATCH ASSEMBLY WAS NO LONGER CONTAINED.  *AK  THE REPLACED LATCH WAS MORE DANGEROUS THAN THE ORIGINAL BECAUSE IT IS NOT PROPERLY SECURED.  *YH
VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE UNDER THE DASH DUE TO A FAULTY WIRING HARNESS.  DEALER HAS INSPECTED  VEHICLE.  *AK

I WAS MAKING A SLOW 90 DEGREE TURN TO THE RIGHT ONTO A DRIVEWAY WHICH WAS APPROXIMATELY 12 " LOWER THAN THE ROAD I WAS ON. AS MY RIGHT WHEEL DROPPED OFF ONTO THE DRIVEWAY, WE HEARD A SHARP CRACKING NOISE. SHORTLY THEREAFTER, I NOTICED THAT THE STEERING WAS STIFF WHEN TURNING TO THE RIGHT. IT WAS THE NEXT DAY, SUNDAY, WHEN AS I TURNED TO THE RIGHT, WE LOST ALL OUR POWER STEERING FLUID WITH A GUSH AS THE POWER STEERING PUMP BLEW ITS FRONT MAINSEAL DUE TO OVERPRESSURING FROM THE BROKEN RACK AND PINION. THE RACK AND PINION MAINSHAFT WAS COMPLETELY SEVERED, IT ACTUALLY TORE OFF ITS WELDED BRACKET ON ONE SIDE AND THE HYDRAULIC CYLINDER WHICH WAS A COMPONENT OF THE SYSTEM, BOUND UP AND BLEW OUT BOTH SEALS. THE MECHANIC INDICATED THAT THIS LEAD TO THE OVERPRESSURE OF THE POWER STEERING SYSTEM WHICH RESULTED IN THE PUMP BLOWING ITS MAINSEAL. HE ALSO SAID HE FELT THAT THE DESIGN OF THE SYSTEM(IE. NOT HAVING BOTH SIDES OF THE RACK AND PINION IN HARD MOUNTS)WAS AT LEAST A PARTIAL CAUSE. ADDITIONALLY, THE MECHANIC INDICATED THAT THE REBUILDER TO WHOM THIS WAS TO BE SENT HAD SEEN ABOUT 10 OTHERS LIKE THIS PREVIOUSLY. HAD ATOTAL COST OF REPAIR WAS ALMOST $1,000.00

WHILE ATTEMPTING TO HAVE RECALL 96V-099 FOR ABS THE DEALER DETERMINED THAT THE ABS PUMP AND MOTOR DID NOT NEED TO BE REPLACED, THEY PERFORMED A DIAGNOSTIC TEST ON THE ABS MODULATOR AND DETERMINED THAT THE CONTROLLER ANTI LOCK BRAKE NEEDED REPLACING, CONSUMER FEELS THAT SINCE THIS IS APART OF THE ABS SYSTEM AND THAT IT SHOULD BE COVERED UNDER RECALL 96V-099. THE ANITLOCK BRAKE AND PARKING BRAKE LIGHT CAME ON DURING A REGULAR SPEED. TOOK TO DEALER ON 8/25/2000, PROBLEM HAPPENED TO BE THE BOOSTER PUMP THAT WAS IN RECALL IN 1996. WE PURCHASED OUR MINI VAN IN NOVEMBER 1996 AND HAD THE FIRST TRANSMISSION FAILURE LESS THAN 2 MONTHS LATER AND HAD THE SAME PROBLEM "REPAIRED" 3 TIMES MORE IN THE 3 YEARS WE HAVE OWNED IT.  IN APRIL 1996, A RECALL WAS ISSUED FOR THE ABS OF THIS MAKE/MODEL/YEAR.  WHEN WE PURCHASED IT, THE DEALERSHIP DID NOT TELL US THIS NOR DID CHRYSLER CORP.  WE FOUND OUT AFTER OUR ABS FAILED WHEN DRIVING.  LUCKILY WE WERE NOT INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT.  IT THEN FAILED AGAIN 6 MONTHS AFTER THEY "FIXED" THE ABS IN FEBRUARY 2000.  THEY WILL NOT DO THE REPAIR NOW FOR UNDER $1600--WE DON'T THINK WE SHOULD BE PAYING ANYTHING!  I BELIEVE WE MAY HAVE BEEN PART OF A CONSUMER FRAUD FROM THE DEALERSHIP AS THEY TOLD US OF NO RECALLS AT THE TIME OF PURCHASE WHEN THERE WERE SEVERAL ISSUED ON THIS PARTICULAR YEAR AND MODEL.  WE WANT CHRYSLER TO REFUND OUR PURCHASE PRICE AND COST OF REPAIRS OVER THE PAST THREE YEARS.  WE DRIVE AROUND WITH OUR 5 CHILDREN IN THE CAR AND CANNOT RISK ANOTHER ABS FAILURE.  THE  ASST TO THE CEO AT DAIMLER CHRYSLER WAS OF NO HELP STATING, "WE DON'T MAKE OUR VEHICLES TO INCONVENIENCE YOU."  WHEN IT IS MORE THAN BEING "INCONVENIENCED"  IT IS ABOUT THE SAFETY OF OUR FAMILY AND OTHER PEOPLE ON THE ROAD AT THE SAME TIME WE ARE.  ANY HELP YOU CAN GIVE US IS MUCH APPRECIATED AS WE WILL NOT GIVE UP UNTIL SOMETHING IS DONE TO REMEDY THIS SITUATION.  THANK YOU.  *AK

ABOUT A YEAR AGO, MY VAN STARTED SHIFTING FUNNY.  I WAS HAVING TROUBLE GOING FROM FIRST GEAR TO SECOND GEAR. IF WE TURNED OFF THE IGNITION, THE COMPUTER WOULD RESET ITSELF AND THE VAN WOULD RUN FINE FOR A WHILE.  THIS WENT ON FOR A FEW MONTHS, THEN WE DECIDED TO HAVE THE TRANSMISSION CHECKED(BECAUSE EVERY ONE WE KNOW WITH CHRYSLER VANS HAS HAD THE TRANSMISSION REPLACED AT SOME TIME), AND THE MECHANIC TOLD US THAT THE COMPUTER JUST NEEDED TO BE RESET,SO WE HAD IT DONE.  THE VAN RAN WELL FOR A FEW MORE MONTHS AND THEN THE TROUBLES STARTED UP AGAIN ONLY WORSE.  WE WERE HAVING INCIDENTS OF NON-SHIFTING ALMOST EVERY TIME WE DROVE THE VAN, SO IT IS NOW PARKED IN THE GARAGE AND HASN'T MOVED FOR ABOUT A MONTH.  WE WOULD LIKE TO GET THE TRANSMISSION FIXED, BUT WANTED TO SEE IF CHRYSLER HAD ANY RECALLS OUT ON THESE VANS.
LEAK IN FUEL INJECTOR RAIL ASSEMBLY COULD HAVE CAUSED AN ENGINE FIRE OR EXPLOSION.  ASSEMBLY HAS NO MOVING PARTS AND SHOULD NOT HAVE LEAKED.

AS I WAS OPENING THE BACK HATCH OF OUR MINIVAN THE TOP BOLT SECURING THE RIGHT HYDRAULIC CYCLINDER SHEARED OFF CAUSING THE TRUNK LID TO ABRUPTLY COME DOWN BRUISING MY RIGHT ARM.  FORTUNATELY THIS HAPPENED WHILE OPENING THE TRUNK BUT IT IS SCAREY TO THINK THAT IT COULD HAVE HAPPENED WHILE THE LID WAS UP AND CAME CRASHING DOWN ON MY CHILDREN.  IRONICALLY THE VEHICLE WAS SERVICED IN ACCORDANCE TO RECALL NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER 97V079000 IN FEB 98.  HOWEVER, THE BOLT WAS NOT REPLACED, ONLY THE WASHERS AS DECRIBED BY THE RECALL NOTICE.  THIS REMEDY WAS NOT ADEQUATE TO PREVENT THE BOLT FROM SHEARING.  BYERS DUBLIN DODGE IN DUBLIN, OHIO WHO ORIGINALLY SERVICED THE VEHICLE FOR RECALL REPLACED BOTH CYLINDERS AT NO COST TO US UNDER RECALL.  HOWEVER, I DID NOTIFY CHRYSLER DIRECTLY AND SPOKE TO CHRIS NEHOFF IN CUSTOMER SERVICE ON MAY 26.  AT THAT TIME CHRYSLER INFORMED ME THAT THERE WAS NO RECALL REGARDING THIS PROBLEM, THAT THE VEHICLE WAS OUT OF WARRANTY, AND IT WAS UNFORTUNATE THAT I WAS INJURED BUT THAT THEY WOULD DO NOTHING.  I WAS NOT PERMITTED TO TALK TO A SUPERVISOR.  AT THAT TIME THE VIN NUMBER I PROVIDED WAS THE ONE FROM THE OWNER'S MANUAL WHICH WAS INCORRECT.  THIS WAS EITHER AN INVALID VIN OR BELONGED TO ANOTHER VEHICLE BUT THE CHRYSLER REPRESENTATIVE DID NOT REALIZE THE PROBLEM.  AFTER FINDING THE RECALL NOTICE MYSELF ON YOUR WEBSITE, I CONTACTED BYERS DUBLIN DODGE ABOUT THE RECALL.  THEY IN TURN CALLED THEIR DISTRICT MANAGER WHO APPARANTLY APPROVED THE REPAIR AT NO COST TO US AND KEPT THE BROKEN HYDRAULIC CYLINDER.  DESPITE THE FACT THAT THE VIN WAS INCORRECT, AN ERROR CHRYSLER SHOULD HAVE CAUGHT, I AM CONFUSED AS TO WHY I WASN'T TOLD ABOUT THE RECALL WHEN I CONTACTED CHRSYLER, AND THE FACT THAT OUR VAN HAD EVEN BEEN SERVICED FOR SUCH A RECALL.  MOREOVER, THIS IS A SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE THAT SUCH A HEAVY OBJECT CAN COME CRASHING DOWN WITHOUT NOTICE AND HAS THE POTENTIAL TO KILL OR SERIOUSLY INJURE ANYONE-ESPECIALLY A SMALL CHILD.  *AK

I WAS PARKED ON A HILL.  MY EIGHT YEAR OLD DAUGHER OPENED THE SLIDING PASSENGER DOOR.  IT SLID OPEN FAST AND CAME OFF THE TRACK.  THE REAR PART OF THE DOOR HIT THE CONCRETE ON THE DRIVEWAY.  THE FRONT PART OF THE DOOR STAYED ATTACHED.  MY NEIGHBOR HELD THE DOOR WHILE I BACKED DOWN THE DRIVEWAY.  WE COULD NOT GET THE DOOR CLOSED NOR WOULD IT COMPLETELY COME OFF THE TRACK.  I CALLED THE KOONS BODY SHOP.  SOME MECHANICS CAME, TOOK THE DOOR OFF AND THEN SOMEHOW REATTACHED IT.  IF SOMEONE HAD BEEN STANDING WHERE THE SLIDING DOOR LANDED A SERIOUS INJURY WOULD HAVE RESULTED.  THE MANUFACTURER ASSUMED NO RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE PROBLEM.  I AM SURE IT IS SOME KIND OF DEFECT IN THE DOOR.  I HAD TO PAY FOR THE REPAIR MYSELF.  I APPEALED ALL THE WAY TO THE ARBITRATION BOARD BUT THE COMPANY WOULD TAKE NO RESPONSIBILITY AT ALL SINCE I WAS PAST THE 12-MONTH WARRANTY PERIOD.   I THINK THIS PROBLEM OCCURRED WITH SOME FREQUENCY WITH THIS VEHICLE SINCE THE BODY SHOP REPAIRMAN WAS VERY FAMILIAR WITH THE PROBLEM.  I AM ALSO HAVING SOME PROBLEMS CURRENTLY (2/27/99) WITH THE RIGHT PASSENGER DOOR WHICH IS OUT OF ALIGNMENT AND AN INDEPENDENT REPAIRMAN HAS CONFIRMED THAT HE SEES THIS QUITE OFTEN.  I DO NOT THINK DOOR STRUCTURES ON THE BODY OF THIS CAR ARE WELL MADE AND I BELIEVE THEY MAY POSE SOME SAFETY HAZARD.
NO SUMMARY

CONSUMER WAS DRIVING APPROX. 45MPH WHEN  VEHICLE OVERHEATED AND A SMELL OF BURNING RUBBER  OR PLASTIC WAS NOTICED. PULLED OVER AND SMOKE WAS COMING FROM WIRING HARNESS OF FIREWALL ON  DRIVER'S SIDE. GARBER COUNTRY AUTOMOTIVE DEALERSHIP (904-284-9811) REPAIRED THE VEHICLE. "CHECK WIRE, UPPER FENDER AREA,  KEPT BURNING,  FUSABLE LINK ". TRANSMISSION WOULD NOT SHIFT INTO THIRD GEAR.   *SLC
THE WELD THAT HOLDS THE FRONT RIGHT SIDE DOOR TOGETHER FAILED, CAUSING THE DOOR TO SAG, AND ALSO THE LATCH DOES NOT WORK.  *AK
COULD NOT SHIFT LEVER BACK TO DRIVE AFTER DOWNSHIFTING/ DEALER SAID  CABLE WAS STRETCHED.
PAINT ON ROOF AND ENGINE COMPARTMENT IS COMPLETELY PEELING OFF.

THE  MIDDLE ROW PASSENGER SIDE SEAT BELT ANCHOR AT THE FLOOR AND THE CLIP THAT HOOKS TO THE FLOOR COMES APART FROM THE HOOK,  CAUSING THE BELT TO SEPARATE FROM THE ANCHOR WHICH RESULTED IN NO RESTRAINT TO THE PASSENGER. THERE WAS INVESTIGATION ON THIS TRUCK FOR THE SEAT BELT, BUT NOW IT IS CLOSED, PE96-008.  *AK

summary: THE FIRST DEALERSHIP CONSUMER WENT TO KEPT SAYING THE RECALL WORK WAS DONE, AND IT HAS NOT BEEN.  THEN SHE WAS AUTHORIZED BY CHRYSLER TO GO TO ANOTHER DEALERSHIP, AND THEY ARE REFUSING SERVICE TO THE OWNER.   *AK  CONSUMER STARTED HAVING ABS LIGHT PROBLEMS PRIOR TO RECALL 96V099, THE DEALER REPLACED THE HYDRAULIC ASSEMBLY, BRAKE SYSTEM, ROTORS , PADS, AND THE ABS MODULE, CONSUMER HAS SPENT A LOT OF MONEY AND IS REQUESTING REIMBURSEMENT DUE TO THE RECALL, DEALER HAS ATTEMPTED TO CORRECT THE ABS PROBLEM, HOWEVER DEALER CAN NOT CORRECT THE PROBLEM.  TRANSMISSION WAS REPLACED AND CONSUMER CONTINUES TO HAVE PROBLEMS WITH AUTOMATIC SHIFTING.  ENGINE WAS NOISY, THERMOSTAT GASKET WAS REPLACED, MOTOR MOUNTS REPLACED, SERPENTINE BELT REPLACED.  EXHAUST SYSTEM, MUFFLER, AND REAR PIPE REPLACED.  REAR SHOCKS REPLACED.  SPARK PLUGS REPLACED.  FUEL FILTER REPLACED.   *SLC
ANTI-LOCK BRAKING SYSTEM FAILED. *AK
BILL BULL CHYSLER DODGE DEALER WILL NOT MAKE AN APPOINTMENT TO FIX THIS CONSUMER'S VEHICLE UNDER RECALL.  PLEASE DESCIRBE DETAILS.   *AK

VEHICLE WAS DRIVEN AT 40 MPH WHEN A BREAKING SOUND WAS HEARD FROM UNDER THE HOOD.  WHEN VEHICLE STOPPED, ENGINE WAS NO LONGER RUNNING AND COULD NOT BE RESTARTED.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED BROKEN PISTON ROD, ONE LEAF OF CRANKSHAFT BROKEN AND THE PISTON WAS CRUSHED TO HALF.  THERE WERE ALSO HOLES IN THE ENGINE BLOCK.
MOUNTING BOLT ON REAR HATCH LIFT CYLINDER FAILURE.  OWNER UNSURE OF RECALL STATIS.
PROP ASSEMBLY BOLT SHEARED OFF CAUSING LIFTGATE TO FAIL.
THE SEAT BELT ANCHOR SPRING CLIP IS LOOSE. VEHICLE  HAS BEEN  TAKEN TO THE DEALER BEFORE IN 1992 FOR THE SAME THING.  *AK
